en: The burden of Egypt. Behold, Jehovah rideth upon a swift cloud, and cometh unto Egypt: and the idols of Egypt shall tremble at his presence; and the heart of Egypt shall melt in the midst of it.
hmr: Aigupta ram phurrik chu, Ngai ta, LALPA chu sûm hrâttak chunga chuongin Aigupta ram a hung tlung tah ie! Aigupta ram milimhai chu a hmaa chun inthin dar dar an ta, Aigupta mihai lungril chu an sûnga chun intuihmang el a tih.

en: And I will stir up the Egyptians against the Egyptians: and they shall fight every one against his brother, and every one against his neighbor; city against city, and kingdom against kingdom.
hmr: Chun, Aigupta mihai chu Aigup- ta mi vêk thaw dingin chawktho ka ta; chuongchun, mi tinin mâni unau thawin, mi tinin mâni tuolbâwmhai thawin, indo an tih; khuo le khuo inthâwng an ta, ram le ram inthâwng an tih.

en: And the spirit of Egypt shall fail in the midst of it; and I will destroy the counsel thereof: and they shall seek unto the idols, and to the charmers, and to them that have familiar spirits, and to the wizards.
hmr: Chuongchun, Aigupta mihai thlarau chu an sûnga chun ieng- khawm ni loa siemin um a ta; an remruot chu suksieng ka tih: chuong- chun, milimhai le, aikeithiemhai le, khawhri aisânthiem zâwlhai le, dawi- thiemhai chu râwn an tih.

en: And I will give over the Egyptians into the hand of a cruel lord; and a fierce king shall rule over them, saith the Lord, Jehovah of hosts.
hmr: Chun, Aigupta mihai chu hotu nunsetak kutah inhlân ka ta; lal nunsetakin an chungah ro rêl tâng a tih, Lalpa, sipaihai LALPA chun a tih.

en: And the waters shall fail from the sea, and the river shall be wasted and become dry.
hmr: Chun, tuipui tuihai chu kang a ta, vadunghai chu luong hmangin hung kang intan tâng a tih.

en: And the rivers shall become foul; the streams of Egypt shall be diminished and dried up; the reeds and flags shall wither away.
hmr: Vadunghai chu hung rimsieng a ta; Aigupta ram tui luonghai chu hung kang deu deu a ta, kang intan el a tih: phairuonghai le tuihnârhai chu ṭâwl zo a tih.

en: The meadows by the Nile, by the brink of the Nile, and all the sown fields of the Nile, shall become dry, be driven away, and be no more.
hmr: Nile vadung kâwla, Nile vadung pang ngeia, ran tlatna phûlhai le, Nile vadung kâwla thil chînghai po po chu hung ṭâwl zo a ta, lên hmangin um an ta, um ta naw nih.

en: And the fishers shall lament, and all they that cast angle into the Nile shall mourn, and they that spread nets upon the waters shall languish.
hmr: Nga mantuhai khawm chu ṭap an ta. Nile vadunga ngakuoi inchie hlak- hai po po chu an âwm inchum an ta, tuia lênkhang kei hlakhai chu châu tâng an tih.

en: Moreover they that work in combed flax, and they that weave white cloth, shall be confounded.
hmr: Chu naw khawm chu ziza zai inhmi them mihai le puon ngo khâwng mihai chu muolpho an tih.

en: And the pillars of Egypt shall be broken in pieces; all they that work for hire shall be grieved in soul.
hmr: Chun, a lung banhai chu suknâwiin um a ta, inhlawfa hlakhai po po chu an lungrilin lungngai an tih.

en: The princes of Zoan are utterly foolish; the counsel of the wisest counsellors of Pharaoh is become brutish: how say ye unto Pharaoh, I am the son of the wise, the son of ancient kings?
hmr: Zoan khuoa mi lienhai chu an invêt ngawt el; Pharao remruottu vartakhai remruot chu sa remruot ang el a hung ni tah; Pharao kuomah, “Mi var naupa, tienlai lalhai naupa ka nih,” iengtiziea ti hlak am in nih a?

en: Where then are thy wise men? and let them tell thee now; and let them know what Jehovah of hosts hath purposed concerning Egypt.
hmr: I mi varhai chu khâw lai am? Anni chun hril nghâl raw hai se che; Aigupta ram chunga thil tlung ding, sipaihai LALPA ruothai chu, hre raw se.

en: The princes of Zoan are become fools, the princes of Memphis are deceived; they have caused Egypt to go astray, that are the corner-stone of her tribes.
hmr: Zoan khuoa mi lienhai chu mi invêt an hung ni tah a, Noph khuoa mi lienhai chu hlêmin an um tah: Aigupta hnamhai kia lunghai chun Aiguptahai chu an invâkhmangtir tah.

en: Jehovah hath mingled a spirit of perverseness in the midst of her; and they have caused Egypt to go astray in every work thereof, as a drunken man staggereth in his vomit.
hmr: LALPA chun Aigupta mihai laia chun kâwmâwsietna thlarau ân umtir tah; chuongchun, zu inrui chu ama luoka a pêm a pêm ang hin Aigupta mihai chu an sinthaw tinrêngah an infe kâwitir tah a.

en: Neither shall there be for Egypt any work, which head or tail, palm-branch or rush, may do.
hmr: Aiguptahai dingin luin amanih, meiin amanih, intûm kauin amanih, thielkuongin amania thawpêk thei um ta bawk naw nih.

en: In that day shall the Egyptians be like unto women; and they shall tremble and fear because of the shaking of the hand of Jehovah of hosts, which he shaketh over them.
hmr: Chu nia chun Aigupta mihai chu nuhmei ruol ang nîng an ta, sipai- hai LALPA kut thin chu an chunga a thin leiin inthinin ṭîng an tih.

en: And the land of Judah shall become a terror unto Egypt; every one to whom mention is made thereof shall be afraid, because of the purpose of Jehovah of hosts, which he purposeth against it.
hmr: Juda rama umhai chu Aigupta mihai ta ding chun râpthlâktak hung ni tâng an ta, an hming an lamna taphawthai chun ṭîng an ta, an chunga tlung ding sipaihai LALPA thuruot lei chun.

en: In that day there shall be five cities in the land of Egypt that speak the language of Canaan, and swear to Jehovah of hosts; one shall be called The city of destruction.
hmr: Chu nia chun Kanaan mihai ṭawnga ṭawng le, sipaihai LALPA kuoma ṭawng inkhâma thu tiem hlakhai chu, Aigupta ram sûngah khaw panga um a ta; pakhat chu Bohmangna Khuo tîng an tih.

en: In that day shall there be an altar to Jehovah in the midst of the land of Egypt, and a pillar at the border thereof to Jehovah.
hmr: Chu nia chun Aigupta ram laia chun LALPA ta dingin mâichâm um a ta, a ramria chun LALPA ta dingin lungphun um a tih.

en: And it shall be for a sign and for a witness unto Jehovah of hosts in the land of Egypt; for they shall cry unto Jehovah because of oppressors, and he will send them a saviour, and a defender, and he will deliver them.
hmr: Chu chu Aigupta rama sipaihai LALPA ta ding chun inchikna le hrietna nîng a tih, nêksâwrtuhai leiin LALPA chu an la ko ding a ni sih a; chuongchun, ama chun sandamtu le humhimtu tir a ta, ama chun annirawi chu sansuok a tih.

en: And Jehovah shall be known to Egypt, and the Egyptians shall know Jehovah in that day; yea, they shall worship with sacrifice and oblation, and shall vow a vow unto Jehovah, and shall perform it.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA chu Aigupta mihai ihriet ni tâng a ta, Aigupta mihai chun chu nia chun LALPA chu hre tâng an tih; anih, inthawina le thilpêkin chibai bûk an tih, LALPA kuoma chun thu tiem an ta, muolsuo bawk an tih.

en: And Jehovah will smite Egypt, smiting and healing; and they shall return unto Jehovah, and he will be entreated of them, and will heal them.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Aigupta mihai chu vuong a ta, sukdam bawk a tih: chuongchun, LALPA kuomah kîr nâwk an ta, ama chu anni ngên thlûk- in um a ta, anni chu sukdam a tih.

en: In that day shall there be a highway out of Egypt to Assyria, and the Assyrian shall come into Egypt, and the Egyptian into Assyria; and the Egyptians shall worship with the Assyrians.
hmr: Chu nia chun Aigupta rama inthawkin Assuria ram chenin lam- lien um a ta; chuongchun, Assuria mihai chu Aigupta ramah fêng an ta, Aigupta mihai chu Assuria ramah fe bawk an tih; Aigupta mihai chun Assuria mihai leh Pathien chu chibai bûk hmunkhat tâng an tih.

en: In that day shall Israel be the third with Egypt and with Assyria, a blessing in the midst of the earth;
hmr: Chu nia chun Israelhai chu Aiguptahai le Assuriahai pathumtu nîng an ta, hnuoi lailia hin malsâwm- na nîng an tih;

en: for that Jehovah of hosts hath blessed them, saying, Blessed be Egypt my people, and Assyria the work of my hands, and Israel mine inheritance.
hmr: sipaihai LALPA chun, “Ka mi Aiguptahai le ka kutsuok Assuria- hai le ka rochan Israelhai chu malsâwmin um raw se,” tiin mal a sâwm sih a.
